review_title: Student Assistant for all years of study
pros: Convenient Location: As a student, working at Trent University allows you to conveniently balance your work and academic commitments. You won't have to travel far, as the university is located on-campus, saving you commuting time and expenses. Flexible Schedules: Trent University recognizes that students have busy schedules due to classes, assignments, and extracurricular activities. Therefore, they often provide flexible work hours that can accommodate your academic timetable, allowing you to earn money while still focusing on your studies. Experience and Skill Development: Working at Trent University can provide you with valuable work experience and help you develop essential skills that are highly sought after by employers. Depending on the job, you can enhance your communication, teamwork, problem-solving, and organizational skills, among others. Networking Opportunities: Being part of the Trent University community through employment can introduce you to various faculty, staff, and fellow students. This exposure can help you build a professional network, make connections with mentors, and potentially open doors to future opportunities such as internships or references. Campus Involvement: Working on campus allows you to immerse yourself in the university environment and engage more actively in campus life. You can participate in events, workshops, and clubs, and gain a deeper sense of belonging to the Trent community.
cons: Time Constraints: Balancing work and academics can be challenging, especially during peak academic periods. Working while being a student may require careful time management and prioritization to ensure that both work and studies receive adequate attention. Work-Life Balance: Working on campus may blur the boundaries between your academic and personal life. It's essential to establish a healthy work-life balance and ensure that your job does not excessively encroach on your personal time and well-being. Limited Career Relevance: Some student positions at Trent University may not directly align with your desired career path or field of study. While the experience and transferable skills gained can be valuable, it's worth considering whether the job will provide the specific professional development you're seeking.

Beautiful campus

Small institution with limited opportunities for growth

A lot needs to be figured out before the institution can operate efficiently but hard to do with small teams, limited resources, and an increasing workload. This is true for many other universities.

pros: Manager works with student's academic schedules when creating shift schedule. There are always opportunities for you to pick up extra shifts. Not strenuous job most times, always time to bring extra work to complete at the desk or watch netflix for 8 hours. Security guards are really nice and don't bother you. With overnight shift you get to leave one hour early but still get paid for that hour. Office is spacious and warm during winter, there's a kitchenette with microwave in the office as well as kitchenette with full kitchen appliances in staff lounge in the building. Many options of tea to pick from.
cons: Might get stuck with overnight or weekend shifts which you are still responsible for fulfilling or finding someone to pick up even during the breaks and holidays. Gets real boring most times as guards are usually out of office on patrols so you are literally the only individual in the whole of BH.
